data.scheme_name: Rajasthan Handicrafts Policy 2022 - Marketing  Centres - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides 50% of the total cost of establishment or a maximum of Rs. 1 lakhs as assistance for setting up marketing centres.
data.eligibility: Artisans registered  with Rajasthan Small Industries Corporation,Rajasthan Hastshilp Vikas Niga , State or National-level Handicraft Boards or Associations.
data.beneficiaries: Artisans registered  with Rajasthan Small Industries Corporation,Rajasthan Hastshilp Vikas Niga , State or National-level Handicraft Boards or Associations.
data.context:
The Handicrafts of Rajasthan have a distinct identity of their own in the country as well as abroad. These crafts include Hand Block Printing, Bandhej, Tie & Dye, Dabu Print, Ajrak Print, Taarkashi, Kundan, Meenakari, Terracotta, Thewa Art, Sculpture, Kota Doria, Jaipuri Razai, Lac Work, Usta Art, Miniature Painting, Blue Pottery, Clay Art, Handmade Paper, Jaipuri & Jodhpuri Jootis, Paper Mache, Stone Carving etc. 

Just as some arts of various regions of India are on the verge of extinction, similarly, some arts and crafts of the State are gradually languishing and about to go extinct which mainly include Odhana, Mendh Printing, Sanjhi Kala, Mandana, Aaraish Kala, Faitia Kala, Theekri Kala etc.
data.objective:
1. Economic upliftment and growth of the artisans of the State.

 2. Ensuring a better marketing system for the products of the artisans.

 3. Making the products of the artisans suitable for export and helping them to gain recognition in the international arena as well as boosting the share of the State in Exports. 

4. Reviving the languishing traditional arts and crafts of the State.

 5. Empowering the artisans of the State and ensuring their contribution in the development of the State. 

6. Creating 50,000 new opportunities for employment in the Handicrafts sector in the next 5 years.
data.description: Assistance for setting up Marketing Centers:- On establishment of permanent Marketing Centres for sale of their handicraft/handloom products by Handloom Weavers Cooperative Societies/ Artisan Societies/ Institutions in urban areas, 50% of the total cost of establishment or a maximum of Rs. 1 lakh, whichever is lesser will be given by the Government as assistance
data.how_to_apply: The eligible beneficiary has to approach Industries, Commerce & MSME Department to get the benefit.
data.funding_mechanism: The benefit will be given after the approval from Industries, Commerce & MSME Department.
data.checklist_info_a:
Aadhar card
Certificate of educational qualification
Residence proof
Income Certificate
Caste certificate (only for reserved category youth)
Disability Certificate (only for disabled youth)
data.checklist_info_d:
Rajasthan State Industrial Development and Investment Corporation Ltd. (RIICO)
Udyog Bhawan, Tilak Marg, Jaipur 302005, Rajasthan, India
Tel: +91 141 2227751-755, 4593201-205
data.beneficiary: Handicraft Industry - All Entities - Rajasthan - All MSMEs and Non MSMEs
